post.description: Records an artifacts cache usage event. The body of this request is an array of cache usage events. The supported event types are `HIT` and `MISS`. The source is either `LOCAL` the cache event was on the users filesystem cache or `REMOTE` if the cache event is for a remote cache. When the event is a `HIT` the request also accepts a number `duration` which is the time taken to generate the artifact in the cache.
post.summary: Record an artifacts cache usage event

403.description:
You do not have permission to access this resource.
The customer has reached their spend cap limit and has been paused. An owner can disable the cap or raise the limit in settings.
The Remote Caching usage limit has been reached for this account for this billing cycle.
Remote Caching has been disabled for this team or user. An owner can enable it in the billing settings.

sessionId.description: A UUID (universally unique identifer) for the session that generated this event.

source.description: One of `LOCAL` or `REMOTE`. `LOCAL` specifies that the cache event was from the user's filesystem cache. `REMOTE` specifies that the cache event is from a remote cache.

event.description: One of `HIT` or `MISS`. `HIT` specifies that a cached artifact for `hash` was found in the cache. `MISS` specifies that a cached artifact with `hash` was not found.

duration.description: The time taken to generate the artifact. This should be sent as a body parameter on `HIT` events.

get.summary: Get a deployment by ID or URL

200.description:
The deployment including only public information
The deployment including both public and private information

items.description: A partial representation of a Build used by the deployment endpoint.

verified.description: `true` if the domain is verified for use with the project. If `false` it will not be used as an alias on this project until the challenge in `verification` is completed.

items.description: A list of verification challenges, one of which must be completed to verify the domain for use on the project. After the challenge is complete `POST /projects/:idOrName/domains/:domain/verify` to verify the domain. Possible challenges: - If `verification.type = TXT` the `verification.domain` will be checked for a TXT record matching `verification.value`.

verification.description: A list of verification challenges, one of which must be completed to verify the domain for use on the project. After the challenge is complete `POST /projects/:idOrName/domains/:domain/verify` to verify the domain. Possible challenges: - If `verification.type = TXT` the `verification.domain` will be checked for a TXT record matching `verification.value`.

autoAssignCustomDomains.description: applies to custom domains only, defaults to `true`

passiveRegions.description: Since November 2023 this field defines a set of regions that we will deploy the lambda to passively Lambdas will be deployed to these regions but only invoked if all of the primary `regions` are marked as out of service

readySubstate.description: Since June 2023 Substate of deployment when readyState is 'READY' Tracks whether or not deployment has seen production traffic: - STAGED: never seen production traffic - PROMOTED: has seen production traffic

passiveConnectConfigurationId.description: Since November 2023 this field defines a connect configuration that will only be used to deploy passive lambdas to (as in passiveRegions)

middlewarePath.description: A middleware key within the `output` key under the build result. Overrides a `middleware` definition.

middleware.description: A middleware index in the `middleware` key under the build result

transferable.description: Whether or not the domain is transferable

transferPolicy.description: The domain's transfer policy (depends on TLD requirements). `charge-and-renew`: transfer will charge for renewal and will renew the existing domain's registration. `no-charge-no-change`: transfer will have no change to registration period and does not require charge. `no-change`: transfer charge is required, but no change in registration period. `new-term`: transfer charge is required and a new registry term is set based on the transfer date. `not-supported`: transfers are not supported for this domain or TLD. `null`: This TLD is not supported by Vercel's Registrar.

status.description: The current state of an ongoing transfer. `pending_owner`: Awaiting approval by domain's admin contact (every transfer begins with this status). If approval is not given within five days, the transfer is cancelled. `pending_admin`: Waiting for approval by Vercel Registrar admin. `pending_registry`: Awaiting registry approval (the transfer completes after 7 days unless it is declined by the current registrar). `completed`: The transfer completed successfully. `cancelled`: The transfer was cancelled. `undef`: No transfer exists for this domain. `unknown`: This TLD is not supported by Vercel's Registrar.

200.description: The list of configurations for the authenticated user

completedAt.description: A timestamp that tells you when the configuration was installed successfully

createdAt.description: A timestamp that tells you when the configuration was created

id.description: The unique identifier of the configuration

integrationId.description: The unique identifier of the app the configuration was created for

ownerId.description: The user or team ID that owns the configuration

projects.description: When a configuration is limited to access certain projects, this will contain each of the project ID it is allowed to access. If it is not defined, the configuration has full access.

source.description: Source defines where the configuration was installed from. It is used to analyze user engagement for integration installations in product metrics.

slug.description: The slug of the integration the configuration is created for.

teamId.description: When the configuration was created for a team, this will show the ID of the team.

updatedAt.description: A timestamp that tells you when the configuration was updated.

userId.description: The ID of the user that created the configuration.

scopes.description: The resources that are allowed to be accessed by the configuration.

disabledAt.description: A timestamp that tells you when the configuration was disabled. Note: Configurations can be disabled when the associated user loses access to a team. They do not function during this time until the configuration is 'transferred', meaning the associated user is changed to one with access to the team.

deletedAt.description: A timestamp that tells you when the configuration was updated.

northstarMigratedAt.description: A timestamp that tells you when the configuration was migrated as part of the Northstar migration. In the future, if we allow integration configurations to be transferred between teams, this field should be cleared upon transfer.

installationType.description: Defines the installation type. - 'external' integrations are installed via the existing integrations flow - 'marketplace' integrations are natively installed: - when accepting the TOS of a partner during the store creation process - if undefined, assume 'external'

post.description: Add a domain to the project by passing its domain name and by specifying the project by either passing the project `id` or `name` in the URL. If the domain is not yet verified to be used on this project, the request will return `verified = false`, and the domain will need to be verified according to the `verification` challenge via `POST /projects/:idOrName/domains/:domain/verify`. If the domain already exists on the project, the request will fail with a `400` status code.

saml.description: When "Single Sign-On (SAML)" is configured, this object contains information that allows the client-side to identify whether or not this Team has SAML enforced.

id.description: The Team's unique identifier.

slug.description: The Team's slug, which is unique across the Vercel platform.

name.description: Name associated with the Team account, or `null` if none has been provided.

avatar.description: The ID of the file used as avatar for this Team.

membership.description: The membership of the authenticated User in relation to the Team.

created.description: Will remain undocumented. Remove in v3 API.

createdAt.description: UNIX timestamp (in milliseconds) when the Team was created.

TeamLimited.description: A limited form of data representing a Team, due to the authentication token missing privileges to read the full Team data.

createdAt.description: UNIX timestamp (in milliseconds) when the User account was created.

softBlock.description: When the User account has been "soft blocked", this property will contain the date when the restriction was enacted, and the identifier for why.

id.description: The User's unique identifier.

email.description: Email address associated with the User account.

name.description: Name associated with the User account, or `null` if none has been provided.

username.description: Unique username associated with the User account.

avatar.description: SHA1 hash of the avatar for the User account. Can be used in conjuction with the ... endpoint to retrieve the avatar image.

defaultTeamId.description: The user's default team. Only applies if the user's `version` is `'northstar'`.

version.description: The user's version. Will either be unset or `northstar`.

AuthUser.description: Data for the currently authenticated User.

limited.description: Property indicating that this User data contains only limited information, due to the authentication token missing privileges to read the full User data. Re-login with email, GitHub, GitLab or Bitbucket in order to upgrade the authentication token with the necessary privileges.

id.description: The User's unique identifier.

email.description: Email address associated with the User account.

username.description: Unique username associated with the User account.

avatar.description: SHA1 hash of the avatar for the User account. Can be used in conjuction with the ... endpoint to retrieve the avatar image.

id.description: The unique identifier of the token.

name.description: The human-readable name of the token.

origin.description: The origin of how the token was created.

oneOf.description: The access scopes granted to the token.
The access scopes granted to the token.

scopes.description: The access scopes granted to the token.

expiresAt.description: Timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the token expires.

activeAt.description: Timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the token was most recently used.

createdAt.description: Timestamp (in milliseconds) of when the token was created.

name.description: The name of the file tree entry

type.description: String indicating the type of file tree entry.

uid.description: The unique identifier of the file (only valid for the `file` type)

children.description: The list of children files of the directory (only valid for the `directory` type)

contentType.description: The content-type of the file (only valid for the `file` type)

mode.description: The file "mode" indicating file type and permissions.
